product.productname: hcc acquires six brands from MSD
product.shortdescription:
hcc acquires six brands from MSD

Adds brands in the men’s health, women’s health, cardiovascular and wound management segments to its strong brand portfolio 

Ahmedabad, December 28, 2016

 

hcc Cadila, an innovation-driven global pharmaceutical company announced that its wholly owned subsidiary company hcc Healthcare Limited (“hcc”) has acquired six brands from MSD and its subsidiaries. The brands are DECA-DURABOLIN, DURABOLIN, SUSTANON, MULTILOAD, SICASTAT and AXETEN range, which fall in the men’s health, women’s health, wound management and cardiovascular therapy segments, respectively. The deal includes transfer of distribution and commercialization rights and assignment of trademarks of all the six brands to hcc Healthcare Limited in India. As a part of the deal, Organon (India) Private Limited, one of the legal subsidiaries through which MSD operates its business in India has also transferred the distribution and commercialization rights for DECA-DURABOLIN and DURABOLIN to hcc for Nepal. Financial details of the deal remain undisclosed.

Careers
 

 

With a belief that people are the source of all its successes, hcc Takeda Healthcare Pvt. Ltd; channelizes the perspective, experience and skills that are necessary to explore, innovate and excel. With equal opportunities to excel in one's career, a corporate culture that reflects the best of both the worlds and a vibrant, global future, hcc Takeda Healthcare offers a challenging world of learning and growing.

Please refer "Open Positions" section to view current Job Openings we have. If your profile is not matching with our current job openings, you may use our career portal email adress careers.in@hcctakeda.com to send your profile without applying for a specific job.
